text: in this video I'm going to show you how
you can use IAM access analyzer custom
policy checks with a cicd pipeline to do
customized automated analysis of IEM
policies custom policy checks support
two types of checks that can be
customized to meet your specific
security requirements the first check
helps answer the question does policy a
allow access to one or more API actions
that I consider critical or sensitive
for example Dynamo DB delete table the
second check helps answer the question
does policy a or my new policy Grant
more access than policy B which can be
my existing policy or a reference policy
this reference policy for example says
that an AM policy can grant access to
all API actions for all resources as
long as it denies the ability to pass I
am roles that sit at a specific path in
our repository we have a cloud formation
template that defines an I am role the
role has an inline policy that's been
updated to Grant access to any Dynamo DB
delete action the the role also grants
access to pass a role which is at a path
that we know from our control policy
should be denied let's commit these
changes and see what
happens after a few seconds we see that
both custom policy checks
failed if we inspect the build logs we
can see the specific statements within
the policy that caused both custom
policy checks to fail we can now use
this information to go back and update
the policy so that it meets our security
requirements if you'd like to learn more
about IM am access analyzer and custom
policy checks check out theem access
analyzer
website
